pros: Great culture and a great mission! Best job I've ever had!

pros: Wonderful mission-aligned work internationally. The teams in Ghana, Guatemala, and Laos are incredible.
cons: During my eighteen months with the organization, I saw eleven full time employees leave the NYC office (excluding myself). For context, the NYC/USA team is generally about 10-15 full-time employees. PoP has seen seven CEOs (interim and full-time) since its founding in 2008. Transparency is supposedly a core value, but leadership responds negatively to employees who express dissent or ask questions. Upper management is very ego-driven and prioritize themselves over their employees and the mission. They do a very good job of optically looking appealing, but in actuality could not be further from the truth. This organization is rooted in white supremacy and colonialism.

review_title: It’s not going to be easy
pros: You work in the field that you applied for. You get to go to a gala and meet celebrities. Sometimes you get included on cool ideas.
cons:
Working at pencils is a promise they have a culture of hiring a lot of interns to do a majority of the work and making you run around and get things done that should’ve been done by upper or senior management. 

Through my time working there I found myself working until about 7PM -8pm just to get things ready, and I felt very exploited as an intern. There was no guidance there was no training there was no mentor ship it was very much we have a lot of listings and calls for you to make and that’s it.

Even though you work in the field that you applied for anyone in the office can can ask you to do anything. During gala season is the most hectic season and you are expected to stay there past five or is frowned upon and if you don’t stay there past five if you can guarantee that you won’t get a permanent position there. There is little To no growth for interns unless you do everything out of the water and then even if you do them I offered to extend your internship.

review_title: As an intern, they made an effort to show me different aspects of the non-profit industry and include me in meetings.

- Team of interns provides opportunity for collaboration on projects
- Work closely with upper management

cons:
- Some days seem slower than others, which can be frustrating

review_title: I was given many opportunities at Pencils of Promise to express my goals and how my role could be tailored to that.
pros: Wonderful work environment, extremely hardworking and committed people. The work is meaningful and the mission of the organization is shared by every single team employee and intern.
cons: There is sometimes a lack of communication between departments. Interns are hired regularly for each department though full time job opportunities are rare following an internship.

job_title: Anonymous Intern in New York, NY
pros: Great experience at PoP. As an intern, they gave me a lot of responsibility and valued my contributions to the team.
cons: The job description for interns often does not fully encompass what you will be working on in. It can sometimes be frustrating with lack of direct supervision or reporting to multiple managers. Definitely expect to be challenged in this role. You will get out of this opportunity as much as you put into it.
